summary: This is an email forwarding a news article about 'Operation Stolen Globe/Epstein' from a U.S. Attorney's Office employee. The sender expresses suspicion about who tipped off the press and references recent interactions with plaintiffs' attorneys. The email requests a meeting with Assistant U.S. Attorneys in California and New Mexico.

persons.name: C. (USAFLS)
persons.context: The sender of the forwarded email, who expresses suspicions about a press leak and requests a meeting with AUSAs.

events.title: Press coverage of Operation Stolen Globe/Epstein
events.description: A news article about 'Operation Stolen Globe/Epstein' appears in the Palm Beach Post, prompting internal email discussion about a potential press leak.

locations: 500 E. Broward Blvd, 7th Floor, Ft Lauderdale, FL 33394
keyFacts: An email dated January 26, 2010, discusses press coverage of 'Operation Stolen Globe/Epstein'.
The sender suspects a press leak may have originated from interactions with plaintiffs' attorneys.
The email requests a meeting with Assistant U.S. Attorneys in California and New Mexico.
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
